oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Knutson, Loyde
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Dance

Wessels, Frances
Wilcox, Martha
Heller, Batya

Metz, Louise

Photographs
Group portraits
Colorado Springs (Colo.)
Colorado
Dancers

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Dancer, choreographer and dance educator Hanya Holm lectures a group of students outdoors in Colorado Springs, Colorado. Students include: Frances Wessels, Martha Wilcox, Batya Heller, Florita Raup, Louise Metz, Joan Palmer, Vera Sears, and Millie Kaeser.
oai_dc:dc.dc:format: Reformatted digital
1 item, (photograph), 8 x 10 inches, black and white
Photographic prints

Written on back of photographic print: "Frances Wessels, Martha Wilcox, Batya H[illegible]ler, Florita Raup, Louise Metz, Joan Palmer, Vera Sears, Millie Kaeser. Hanya Holm in Colo Springs, 1943 or 1944." Stamped on back of photographic print: "Photograph By Loyde Knutson, Colorado Springs." Written on front of folder: "b&w candid lecturing students incl. Martha Wilcox, Vera Sears. 1934 of 4 Knutson, Vera Sears (D)."

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Eve Gentry, Mimi Kagan, Harriet Roeder and Valerie Bettis (left to right), members of Hanya Holm's dance company, perform Holm's modern dance work "Dance of Work and Play."
oai_dc:dc.dc:format: Reformatted digital
1 item, (photograph), 7 x 7 inches, black and white
Photographic prints

Stamped on back of photographic print: "Library, Colorado Women's College." Written on back of photographic print: "L to R - Eve entry, Mimi Kagan, Harriet Roeder?, Valerie Bettis? in "Dance of Work and Play" (Hanya Hlom). Nee Henrietta Greenhood. Participated in premier of Hanya Holm's "Trend," 1937. Pic folder, Gentry, Eve." Written on front of folder: "Action still w. Mimi Kagan, Harriet Roeder (?), Vallerie Bettis (?), "Dance of Work and Play" (Hanya Holm) n.d. (ca. 1937-8). no credit."

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Louise Kloepper and Hanya Holm Perform Metropolitan Daily
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Dance
Modern dance
Holm, Hanya
Kloepper, Louise
Photographs
Action shots
Dancers
Choreographers
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Louise Kloepper (Left) and Hanya Holm (right) perform "Want Ad" from "Metropolitan Daily," a work choreographed by Hanya Holm. "Metropolitan Daily," Holm's satiric look at newspapers, was the first modern dance work to be performed on television.
oai_dc:dc.dc:format: Reformatted digital
1 item, (photograph), 8 x 10 inches, black and white
Photographic prints

Stamped on back of photographic print: "Library, Colorado Women's College." Written on back of photographic print: "L - R - Louise Kloepper, Hanya Holm, from "MeTropoliTan Daily - Want Ad." 1938? This dance was the first one ever to be televised (CBS?). Pic folder Holm, Hanya." Written on front of folder: "action still w. Louise Kloepper, "Metropolitan Daily (Want Ad)" (Holm) ca. 1938 no credit."
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Copyright may apply. User is responsible for all copyright compliance.
